member.summary: DOTween's version

member.name: F:DG.Tweening.DOTween.useSafeMode
member.summary: If TRUE makes tweens slightly slower but safer, automatically taking care of a series of things (like targets becoming null while a tween is playing)

member.name: F:DG.Tweening.DOTween.timeScale
member.summary: Global DOTween timeScale

member.name: F:DG.Tweening.DOTween.defaultEaseType
member.summary: Default ease applied to all new tweens

member.name: F:DG.Tweening.DOTween.defaultLoopType
member.summary: Default loopType applied to all new tweens

member.name: F:DG.Tweening.DOTween.defaultAutoPlayBehaviour
member.summary: Default autoPlay behaviour for new tweens

member.name: F:DG.Tweening.DOTween.defaultAutoKill
member.summary: Default autoKillOnComplete behaviour for new tweens

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Init(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,DG.Tweening.LogBehaviour)
member.summary: Must be called once, before the first ever DOTween call/reference, otherwise, it will be called automatically and will use default options. Calling it a second time won't have any effect.
member.param: All newly created tweens will have their autoKill property set accordingly (TRUE: they are automatically killed when complete, FALSE: you will need to kill them manually). You can change this setting at any time by changing the property. Default: TRUE

If TRUE makes tweens slightly slower but safer, automatically taking care of a series of things (like targets becoming null while a tween is playing). You can change this setting at any time by changing the property. Default: FALSE
Type of logging to use. You can change this setting at any time by changing the property. Default: Default

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.SetTweensCapacity(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Directly sets the current max capacity of Tweeners and Sequences, so that DOTween doesn't need to automatically increase them in case the max is reached (which might lead to hiccups when that happens). Sequences capacity must be less or equal to Tweeners capacity (if you pass a low Tweener capacity it will be automatically increased to match the Sequence's). Beware: use this method only when there are no tweens running.
member.param: Max Tweeners capacity. Default: 200
Max Sequences capacity. Default: 50

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Clear
member.summary: Kills all tweens and clears the pools containing eventually cached tweens

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Complete
member.summary: Completes all tweens and returns the number of actual tweens completed (meaning tweens that don't have infinite loops and were not already complete)

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Complete(System.Int32)
member.summary: Completes all tweens with the given ID and returns the number of actual tweens completed (meaning the tweens with the given id that don't have infinite loops and were not already complete)

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Complete(System.String)
member.summary: Completes all tweens with the given string ID and returns the number of actual tweens completed (meaning the tweens with the given id that don't have infinite loops and were not already complete)

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Complete(System.Object)
member.summary: Completes all tweens with the given object ID and returns the number of actual tweens completed (meaning the tweens with the given id that don't have infinite loops and were not already complete)

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Flip
member.summary: Flips all tweens (changing their direction to forward if it was backwards and viceversa), then returns the number of actual tweens flipped

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Flip(System.Int32)
member.summary: Flips the tweens with the given ID (changing their direction to forward if it was backwards and viceversa), then returns the number of actual tweens flipped

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Flip(System.String)
member.summary: Flips the tweens with the given string ID (changing their direction to forward if it was backwards and viceversa), then returns the number of actual tweens flipped

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Flip(System.Object)
member.summary: Flips the tweens with the given object ID (changing their direction to forward if it was backwards and viceversa), then returns the number of actual tweens flipped

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Goto(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends all tweens to the given position (calculating also eventual loop cycles) and returns the actual tweens involved

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Goto(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends all tweens with the given ID to the given position (calculating also eventual loop cycles) and returns the actual tweens involved

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Goto(System.String,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends all tweens with the given string ID to the given position (calculating also eventual loop cycles) and returns the actual tweens involved

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Goto(System.Object,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends all tweens with the given object ID to the given position (calculating also eventual loop cycles) and returns the actual tweens involved

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Kill
member.summary: Kills all tweens and returns the number of actual tweens killed

member.summary: Kills all tweens with the given ID and returns the number of actual tweens killed

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Kill(System.String)
member.summary: Kills all tweens with the given string ID and returns the number of actual tweens killed

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Kill(System.Object)

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Pause
member.summary: Pauses all tweens and returns the number of actual tweens paused

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Pause(System.Int32)
member.summary: Pauses all tweens with the given ID and returns the number of actual tweens paused (meaning the tweens that were actually playing and have been paused)

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Pause(System.String)
member.summary: Pauses all tweens with the given string ID and returns the number of actual tweens paused (meaning the tweens with the given id that were actually playing and have been paused)

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Pause(System.Object)
member.summary: Pauses all tweens with the given object ID and returns the number of actual tweens paused (meaning the tweens with the given id that were actually playing and have been paused)

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Play
member.summary: Plays all tweens and returns the number of actual tweens played (meaning tweens that were not already playing or complete)

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Play(System.Int32)
member.summary: Plays all tweens with the given ID and returns the number of actual tweens played (meaning the tweens with the given id that were not already playing or complete)

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Play(System.String)
member.summary: Plays all tweens with the given string ID and returns the number of actual tweens played (meaning the tweens with the given id that were not already playing or complete)

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.Play(System.Object)
member.summary: Plays all tweens with the given object ID and returns the number of actual tweens played (meaning the tweens with the given id that were not already playing or complete)

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.PlayBackwards
member.summary: Plays all tweens in backwards direction and returns the number of actual tweens played (meaning tweens that were not already started, playing backwards or rewinded)

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.PlayBackwards(System.String)
member.summary: Plays all tweens with the given string ID in backwards direction and returns the number of actual tweens played (meaning the tweens with the given id that were not already started, playing backwards or rewinded)

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.DOTween.PlayBackwards(System.Object)

member.name: M:DG.Tweening.Core.Easing.Back.EaseIn(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Easing equation function for a back (overshooting cubic easing: (s+1)*t^3 - s*t^2) easing in: accelerating from zero velocity.
member.param: Current time (in frames or seconds).
Starting value.
Change needed in value.
Expected easing duration (in frames or seconds).
Overshoot ammount: higher means greater overshoot (0 produces cubic easing with no overshoot, and the default value of 1.70158 produces an overshoot of 10 percent).
Unused: here to keep same delegate for all ease types.
